MajorClaims.MC1: there are other equally vital aspects that need to be considered in this regard
MajorClaims.MC2: I disagree with the idea that salary outweighs any other motivators

Claims.C1: the salary is very pivotal factor
Claims.C2: there are other even more important aspects such as: friendly co-workers, working conditions and professional achievements
Claims.C3: in order for people to cover their daily and general needs they need money as well
Claims.C4: career promotion or getting some kind of credit from the administration of a company or organization are, likely, more enjoyable achievements than getting a high salary

Premises.P1: People, for instance, who don't like their co-workers and working condition are considered less satisfied with their jobs, despite of a high salary
Premises.P2: aspects such as: friendly colleagues, environment and work-place condition, sometimes, have even more impact on person's happiness and quality of life
Premises.P3: most of the satisfaction of a job comes to people from their professional achievements, skills and the position they reach
Premises.P4: people, who work in monotonous jobs, where no achievements or a new positions can be reached feel themselves more dissatisfied, even though they have a very good salaries
